title: Meet_the_Gimp_Videopodcast_Episode_020_Animation
description:
Meet the Gimp! is a weekly video podcast or tutorial about the Gimp graphics software from the viewpoint of a digital photographer. More information at http://meetthegimp.org

Gimp can produce animated GIF files. ItÃƒÂ¢??s easy, if you understand that each layer is one image in a stack. It is shown for a short time and then replaced by the next one.

This time there are no files for downloading - just ÃƒÂ¢??stealÃƒÂ¢?? them from http://meetthegimp.org as described in the video. Explore the annoying one on top of this entry, it uses the ÃƒÂ¢??optimizationÃƒÂ¢?? option youÃƒÂ¢??ll find in the animation menue. It didnÃƒÂ¢??t made the show, but youÃƒÂ¢??ll find your way around.

Visit the Blog ÃƒÂ¢??Linux for PhotographersÃƒÂ¢?? , even if you are using an other OS. He has a lot to share about photography and Open Source programs.

On the meetthegimp.org group at 23 is a thread about an Adventskalender. This is an old German tradition and you are invited to join the fun.

The panorama challenge from show 19 is open until mid december. Build a panorama and put it online in the photogroup. ItÃƒÂ¢??s free - and you even can win a bit.

IÃƒÂ¢??ll take a break from making this videos from mid December to mid January. In this time IÃƒÂ¢??ll think about how to improve the show.
